message_1: A student is trying to synthesize a compound in the lab. The theoretical yield of the compound is 15 g, but due to some errors during the experiment, the student was only able to obtain 10 g in the end. Calculate the percent yield of the experiment.
message_2:
To calculate the percent yield of the experiment, you can use the following formula:

Percent Yield = (Actual Yield / Theoretical Yield) x 100

In this case, the actual yield is 10 g, and the theoretical yield is 15 g. Plug these values into the formula:

Percent Yield = (10 g / 15 g) x 100

Percent Yield = (0.6667) x 100

Percent Yield = 66.67%

The percent yield of the experiment is 66.67%.
